Build, run, and manage structured microservice applications

Cellery makes it faster and simpler to build, test, deploy, run and manage microservice applications. Cellery helps structure cloud native applications using APIs and clear dependencies. Cellery is open source and supports all languages.

Get Started
Try out cellery instantly

<

Why use Cellery?

Quickly create cloud native apps

Cellery simplifies creating cloud native applications. Using code instead of YAML, build and deploy apps on Kubernetes. Use any language to write you apps.

Agile Development

Cellery is designed around agile development and DevOps practices. Push and pull complex applications in a single step.

Structure and Secure Microservice Applications

Cellery brings simple clear structure to microservice applications, using secure APIs and dependency management.

Observable

Cellery generates diagrams showing how your microservices fit together. At runtime these diagrams automatically become observable with monitoring and tracing.

How does Cellery work?

  • Write simple code that packages microservices together into cells, which are simply groups of microservices with well-defined APIs.
  • Compile cells into immutable images. Push and pull images from any docker repository.
  • Connect cells together into applications.
  • Your application is secure by default using mTLS and JWT tokens with embedded microgateways.
  • Manage and observe cells with simple tools, tracing, and monitoring.
  • Cellery extends Kubernetes and Istio, supporting multiple clouds including Google, AWS, Azure and OpenShift.
  • Cellery is completely open source and supports writing apps in any language
